snippet: Conflicts with humans have arisen in the few places where the endangered animals have rebounded thanks to conservation efforts.
abstract: Lethal tiger attacks on people in northern India have risen along with conservation efforts that have allowed populations of endangered Bengal tigers to rebound; attacks are assumed to be work of one female tiger, and community has called for it to be killed; authorities and conservationists, however, urge caution in approaching difficult task of capturing tiger.

byline.original: By ELLEN BARRY and HARI KUMAR

lead_paragraph: Conflicts with humans have arisen in the few places where the endangered animals have rebounded thanks to conservation efforts.

headline.main: Tiger Population Grows in India, as Does Fear After Attacks
headline.print_headline: Tiger Population Grows in India, as Does Fear After Attacks
